edu.snu.onyx.runtime.executor.data.stores

Class LocalBlockStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.snu.onyx.runtime.executor.data.stores.AbstractBlockStore
      • edu.snu.onyx.runtime.executor.data.stores.LocalBlockStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BlockStore
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LocalFileStore, MemoryStore, SerializedMemoryStore

    public abstract class LocalBlockStore
extends AbstractBlockStore
    This abstract class represents BlockStore which contains the (meta)data of the Blocks in local. Because of this, store can maintain all blocks in a single map (mapped with their IDs).

    • Method Detail

      • putPartitions

        public final <K extends Serializable> Optional<List<Long>> putPartitions(String blockId,
                                                                         Iterable<NonSerializedPartition<K>> partitions,
                                                                         boolean commitPerPartition)
                                                                  throws BlockWriteException
        Description copied from interface: BlockStore
        Saves an iterable of NonSerializedPartitions to a block. If the block exists already, appends the data to it. Invariant: This method may not support concurrent write for a single block. Only one thread have to write at once.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the partitions.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        partitions - to save to a block.
        commitPerPartition - whether commit every partition write or not.
        Returns:
        the size of the data per partition (only when the data is serialized).
        Throws:
        BlockWriteException - for any error occurred while trying to write a block. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)
        See Also:
        BlockStore.putPartitions(String, Iterable, boolean)

      • putSerializedPartitions

        public final <K extends Serializable> List<Long> putSerializedPartitions(String blockId,
                                                                         Iterable<SerializedPartition<K>> partitions,
                                                                         boolean commitPerPartition)
        Description copied from interface: BlockStore
        Saves an iterable of SerializedPartitions to a block. If the block exists already, appends the data to it. Invariant: This method may not support concurrent write for a single block. Only one thread have to write at once.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the partitions.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        partitions - to save to a block.
        commitPerPartition - whether commit every partition write or not.
        Returns:
        the size of the data per partition (only when the data is serialized).
        See Also:
        BlockStore.putSerializedPartitions(String, Iterable, boolean)

      • getPartitions

        public final <K extends Serializable> Optional<Iterable<NonSerializedPartition<K>>> getPartitions(String blockId,
                                                                                                  KeyRange<K> keyRange)
        Description copied from interface: BlockStore
        Retrieves NonSerializedPartitions. They belong to a specific KeyRange from a block.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the partitions.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the target partition.
        keyRange - the key range.
        Returns:
        the result elements from the target block (if the target block exists).
        See Also:
        BlockStore.getPartitions(String, KeyRange)

      • commitBlock

        public final void commitBlock(String blockId)
        Description copied from interface: BlockStore
        Notifies that all writes for a block is end. Subscribers waiting for the data of the target block are notified when the block is committed. Also, further subscription about a committed block will not blocked but get the data in it and finished.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        See Also:
        BlockStore.commitBlock(String)

      • getBlockMap

        public final ConcurrentHashMap<String,Block> getBlockMap()
        Returns:
        the map between the IDs and Block.
